candidates.definition: Movement that involves crossing a boundary or threshold between locations or states

positive_examples: The train pulled into the station and passengers began getting off
She walked through the front door after work
The ship disappeared over the horizon
We boarded the plane for our vacation
He returned home after his business trip
The guests are leaving the party now
negative_examples: The car drove steadily down the highway
She walked around the block for exercise
The ball rolled across the floor
He moved the furniture to the other side of the room
The river flows through the valley
They marched in formation across the field
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Traveling, Wandering, Chasing, Following

candidates.definition: alterations in the rate of movement or velocity

positive_examples: The car accelerated rapidly down the highway
She slowed down as she approached the intersection
The train gradually picked up speed leaving the station
He decelerated smoothly before the turn
The runner increased her pace in the final stretch
The plane reduced its velocity for landing
negative_examples: The car maintained a steady 60 mph on the cruise control
She walked at a constant pace throughout her morning jog
The conveyor belt moved at uniform speed all day
He stood perfectly still at the bus stop
The satellite orbited at consistent velocity
The pendulum swung back and forth at regular intervals
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: DirectionalChanges, MovementPatterns, StationaryPositions, ConstantMotion

candidates.definition: The act of an aircraft changing its position through takeoff, flight, or landing maneuvers.

positive_examples: The plane is preparing for takeoff on runway 24.
Flight 447 made an emergency landing in the cornfield.
The seaplane touched down smoothly on the lake surface.
The helicopter descended slowly onto the hospital helipad.
The fighter jet executed a vertical takeoff from the aircraft carrier.
The cargo plane circled the airport before attempting another landing approach.
negative_examples: The train pulled into the station right on schedule.
The ship docked at the harbor after a long voyage.
The car accelerated quickly down the highway.
The submarine surfaced near the coast.
The elevator moved between floors in the building.
The conveyor belt transported packages through the warehouse.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: VehicleMotion, WaterTransport, RailTransport, PedestrianMovement

candidates.definition: Movement that crosses established boundaries, barriers, or territorial limits

positive_examples: The refugees crossed the border into the neighboring country seeking asylum
She slipped through the fence and onto the private property
The spy infiltrated enemy territory undetected
The prisoner escaped through a hole in the wall
Immigrants moved to America for better opportunities
The protestors broke through the police barricade
negative_examples: The train moved back and forth on the same track
She paced nervously in the waiting room
The pendulum swung from side to side
He jogged around the neighborhood block
The dancer moved gracefully across the stage
The elevator went up and down between floors
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: CircularMotion, LinearMovement, RepeatedMovement, VerticalMovement

candidates.definition: Movement with a clear orientation toward or away from a reference point or target.

positive_examples: The cat walked toward the door when it heard footsteps.
She stepped back from the edge of the cliff.
The crowd surged forward to get closer to the stage.
He leaned away from the smoking barbecue.
The dog ran up to greet the visitors at the gate.
The child moved closer to her mother during the thunderstorm.
negative_examples: The dancer spun gracefully in circles on the stage.
She wandered aimlessly through the garden paths.
The ball rolled randomly across the uneven ground.
He paced back and forth in the hallway.
The leaves swirled chaotically in the wind.
The robot moved in precise geometric patterns.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: CircularMotion, RandomMovement, OscillatingMotion, PatternedMovement

candidates.definition: Different methods or ways of moving from one place to another through physical motion

positive_examples: The baby is crawling across the living room floor
The bird was flying gracefully through the morning sky
She was walking briskly down the sidewalk to catch her bus
The cat fell from the tree branch onto the soft grass below
He stumbled and went tumbling down the hillside
The dancer was gliding smoothly across the stage
negative_examples: The car was speeding down the highway at 80 mph
The elevator moved slowly between floors
The conveyor belt transported packages to the loading dock
She pushed the shopping cart through the grocery store
The river flows downstream toward the ocean
The train rolled along the tracks toward the station
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: VehicularMovement, MechanicalTransport, FluidFlow, ObjectDisplacement
